metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0723 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the tty_ioctl function in drivers/tty/tty_io.c in the Linux kernel through 4.4.1 allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory or cause a denial of service (use-after-free and system crash) by making a TIOCGETD ioctl call during processing of a TIOCSETD ioctl call. It was discovered that a race condition existed in the ioctl handler for the TTY driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-83-generic - 3.13.0-83.127
linux-image-3.13.0-83-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-83.127
linux-image-3.13.0-83-lowlatency - 3.13.0-83.127
linux-image-3.13.0-83-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-83.127
linux-image-3.13.0-83-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-83.127
linux-image-3.13.0-83-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-83.127
linux-image-3.13.0-83-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-83.127
linux-image-3.13.0-83-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-83.127
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-83-generic - 3.13.0-83.127
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-69-generic - 3.16.0-69.89~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-69-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-69.89~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-83.127').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
